page.title: 05FARMING
page.content: THERE ARE 11 OR 12 FARMS IN THE AREA. THEY FALL INTO TWO DISTINCT TYPES. HERE IS A DESCRIPTION OF A GRASSLAND FARM WITH CATTLE. FOR THE OTHER TYPE SEE PAGE 6. THE FARM CONSISTS OF 120 ACRES. THERE ARE TWO BULLS, ONE FRIESIAN AND ONE ABERDEEN ANGUS. 80 FRIESIAN COWS,SOME MILKING AND SOME DRY. 40 FRIESIAN HEFFERS,SOME MILKING AND SOME READY TO CALVE.37 FRIESIAN AND 13 ABERDEEN ANGUS CALVES. 110 ACRES OF GRASSLAND FOR SILAGE AND 4 ACRES FOR HAY. 2 CUBICLE SHEDS AND MILKING SHEDS. TOTAL MILK YIELD IN SUMMER IS APPROX. 1300 LITRES A DAY.YIELD VARIES FROM 5 TO 36 LITRES A DAY. THERE ARE 4 TRACTORS,3 TRAILERS,1 GRASS MOWER,1 MANURE SPREADER,1 PLOUGH 1 BAILER AND OTHER IMPLIMENTS.
